allQuestion.questionText: Javascript is an _______ language?
allQuestion.explanation: Javascript is an Object-Oriented Language.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following keywords is used to define a variable in Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: Both var and let keywords are used to define a variable in Javascript.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following methods is used to access HTML elements using Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: Both the above methods are used to access HTML elements using Javascript.

allQuestion.questionText: Upon encountering empty statements, what does the Javascript Interpreter do?
allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript, the interpreter will ignore the empty statements whenever it encounters them.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following methods can be used to display data in some form using Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: All of the above methods are used to display data in some form using Javascript.

allQuestion.questionText: How can a datatype be declared to be a constant type?
allQuestion.explanation: The const keyword is used to declare a variable as a constant type in Javascript and tells the compiler that its value cannot be changed later in the program.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: In the above code snippet, the first number is of integer type and the second of string type. The code snippet gives priority to the string type and concatenates them due to the ‘+’ operator.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The substring function in javascript slices a substring out of a given string from the start to end indexes(excluding the end index). So the 2nd and 3rd characters are taken here(0-based indexing) and the answer is al.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The eval() function evaluates the expression passed into it as a parameter and returns the result after evaluation.

allQuestion.questionText: When the switch statement matches the expression with the given labels, how is the comparison done?

options.text: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.
Only the datatype of the expression is compared.
Only the value of the expression is compared.

correctAnswers: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.
allQuestion.explanation: Switch performs an ‘===’ based comparison, i.e both the value of the expression and its datatype is compared.

allQuestion.questionText: What keyword is used to check whether a given property is valid or not?
allQuestion.explanation: The in keyword is used to check whether the given property is valid or not in Javascript.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the use of the <noscript> tag in Javascript?

options.text: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.
Clears all the cookies and cache.

correctAnswers: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.
allQuestion.explanation: The <noscript> tag is displayed by non-Javascript browsers only.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: First the 2 is printed with the console.log, then even with a time delay of 0ms, the 4 is printed before the 3 because JS executes setTimeout with the Web API, and so the entire function is executed first. Lastly, after a delay of 2000ms, the 1 is printed.

allQuestion.explanation: The sqrt() method returns the square root of the passed parameter, which is in an inbuilt javascript function.

allQuestion.questionText: When an operator’s value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
allQuestion.explanation: Any NULL value of operator will always return typeof object.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The loop will run 3 times, before meeting the exit condition. First value of b will be 2 * 2 = 4, followed by 4 + 3 * 2 = 10, and then value of 10 + 4 * 2 = 18.

allQuestion.questionText: What does the Javascript “debugger” statement do?

options.text: It will debug all the errors in the program at runtime.
It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
It will debug error in the current statement if any.

correctAnswers: It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
allQuestion.explanation: ‘debugger’ statement is used to setup the breakup points at probable points of error in the code snippet, using the debugger window.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The Math.max() method returns -Infinity by default and the Math.min() method returns Infinity value by default when passed without any parameters.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript Math.max() is lesser than Math.min() because Math.max() returns -Infinity and Math.min() returns Infinity.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript, true is considered as the number 1 when used in any arithmetic expression, hence the expression evaluates to 5.
allQuestion.codeContent:
var a = true + true + true * 3;
print(a)

allQuestion.questionText: What is the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript, NaN is not considered to be equal to NaN even after using the strict equality operator.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: NaN in Javascript is defined to be of type number despite its name(not a number).

allQuestion.questionText: What does the ‘toLocateString()’ method do in JS?

options.text: Returns a localized string representation of an object.

correctAnswers: Returns a localized string representation of an object.
allQuestion.explanation: The ‘toLocateString()’ method in JS returns a localized string representation of an object.

allQuestion.questionText: The process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage is called?
allQuestion.explanation: Object Serialization is the process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage.

allQuestion.questionText: Which function is used to serialize an object into a JSON string in Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: The JSON.stringify() function is used to convert a JSON object into string format.

allQuestion.questionText: The 3 basic object attributes in Javascript are:

options.text: Classes, Native object, and Interfaces and Object's extensible flag.

correctAnswers: Classes, Native object, and Interfaces and Object's extensible flag.
allQuestion.explanation: In general for objects in Javascript, the objects are associated with 3 basic attributes, Class, prototype, object's extensible flag.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The parseInt() method converts a string to an integer if it is possible. If the string starts with a number, it will convert that numeric part and return it. Else, it will return NaN.
allQuestion.codeContent:
print(parseInt("123Hello"));
print(parseInt("Hello123"));

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following are closures in Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: Every time a function is created in JS, a closure is created. So, all closures are functions and functions have a scope chain that is associated with them.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following is not a Javascript framework?
allQuestion.explanation: Other than Cassandra, all the other options are Javascript frameworks.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript, the a[i] - ‘a’ is not typecasted to an integer type and hence the result is NaN.

allQuestion.questionText: What keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: The async keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript.

allQuestion.questionText: How to stop an interval timer in Javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: clearInterval is used to stop an interval timer in JS.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: First 2 numbers are added as integers, followed by string concatenation. Finally, since both are not of string type, JS stringifies both the object and the number and concatenates them. When an object is stringified it is read as [object Object] and then concatenated.

allQuestion.questionText: How are objects compared when they are checked with the strict equality operator?

options.text: The contents of the objects are compared

allQuestion.explanation: In Javascript, objects are passed by reference and hence the strict equality operator compares their references.

allQuestion.questionText: What does … operator do in JS?

options.text: It is used to spread iterables to individual elements
It is used to describe a datatype of undefined size

correctAnswers: It is used to spread iterables to individual elements
allQuestion.explanation: The … operator is used to spread iterables to individual elements in Javascript and is also called the spread operator.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: This code snippet shows one of the many applications of the binary search algorithm in Javascript. Here, we are binary searching for the index of the first occurrence of the character ‘1’ in the given string. When we get the character ‘1’ at the mid index, we store it as the answer and move to the left half which will have the first index of ‘1’ if it occurs. Else we move to the right half. So, the answer will be 7 (0-based indexing).

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The code snippet basically uses binary search to calculate the floor of the square root of a number. Since the square root is an increasing function, so binary search is applicable here. Here, for n = 24, the answer is 4.

allQuestion.questionText: How do we write a comment in javascript?
allQuestion.explanation: The correct syntax of writing a comment in Javascript is // This is a comment.

allQuestion.questionText: Which object in Javascript doesn’t have a prototype?

options.text: None of the objects have a prototype

allQuestion.explanation: Base objects are the only objects in Javascript that don’t have a prototype.

allQuestion.questionText: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
allQuestion.explanation: The …args parameter allows us to collect all remaining arguments into an array, and in Javascript typeof an array is an object.

console.log(obj1);

allQuestion.explanation: All of the above options are not server-side Javascript objects.

allQuestion.explanation: opacity

Set different list item markers for unordered lists
Set an image as the list item marker

allQuestion.explanation: All of the above

Style the first letter or line of an element.

allQuestion.questionText: How many layout modes were there before the Flexbox Layout Module was introduced in CSS?
What does the abbreviation HTML stand for?
allQuestion.explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.

allQuestion.questionText: How many sizes of headers are available in HTML by default?
allQuestion.explanation: 6 headers are available in HTML by default ranging from h1 to h6.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the smallest header in HTML by default?
allQuestion.explanation: h6 is the smallest header in HTML by default.

allQuestion.questionText: What are the types of lists available in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: The lists available in HTML are Ordered and Unordered List.

allQuestion.questionText: How to create an ordered list in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: An ordered list is created in HTML by using the <ol> tag.

allQuestion.questionText: HTML files are saved by default with the extension?
allQuestion.explanation: HTML files are saved by the .html or .htm extension.

allQuestion.questionText: We enclose HTML tags within?
allQuestion.explanation: HTML tags are enclosed within < > according to syntax.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the effect of the <b> tag?

options.text: It converts the text within it to bold font.
It is used to write black-colored font.
It is used to change the font size.

correctAnswers: It converts the text within it to bold font.
allQuestion.explanation: <b> is used to convert the text within it to bold font.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following is correct about HTML?

options.text: HTML uses tags defined within the language.

correctAnswers: HTML uses tags defined within the language.
allQuestion.explanation: HTML can only use the tags defined within the language.

allQuestion.questionText: How to display preformatted text in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: <pre> tags is used to handle preformatted text in HTML.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following tags doesn’t require a closing tag?
allQuestion.explanation:
Both the
and the
tag doesn’t require a closing tag.

allQuestion.questionText: What is meant by an empty tag in HTML?

options.text: There is no such concept of an empty tag in HTML
An empty tag does not require a closing tag
An empty tag cannot have any content within it

correctAnswers: An empty tag does not require a closing tag
allQuestion.explanation: In HTML, empty tags are those tags that don’t require a closing tag for completion.

allQuestion.questionText: What are the attributes used to change the size of an image?
allQuestion.explanation: Width and Height attributes are used to change the size of an image.

allQuestion.questionText: Which attribute is used to provide a unique name to an HTML element?
allQuestion.explanation: An id is used to provide a unique name for an HTML element that can be used to identify it.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the function of the HTML style attribute?

options.text: It is used to add styles to an HTML element.
It is used to uniquely identify some specific styles of some element.

correctAnswers: It is used to add styles to an HTML element.
allQuestion.explanation: The HTML style attribute is used to add styles like font, color, and size to an HTML element.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following is the correct syntax for using the HTML style attribute?
allQuestion.explanation: The correct syntax for the style attribute is shown in Option A.

allQuestion.questionText: Which HTML element is used to define description data?
allQuestion.explanation: Description data is defined by <dd> tag.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following properties is used to change the font of text?
allQuestion.explanation: The font-family property is used to change text font in HTML

allQuestion.questionText: How are quotations defined in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: The <blockquote> tag is used to define a section that is quoted from another source.

allQuestion.questionText: What tag is used to render an image on a webpage?
allQuestion.explanation: The img tag is used to display an image on a webpage.

allQuestion.questionText: Apart from <i> tag, which of the following tag is used to render a text in italics?
allQuestion.explanation: The <em> tag is used to emphasize text, which puts same effect as <i> tag.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the correct syntax to write an HTML comment?
allQuestion.explanation: The correct syntax of writing an HTML comment is shown in option A.

allQuestion.questionText: Colors are defined in HTML using?
allQuestion.explanation: Colors are defined using RGB, HEX, HSL, RGBA, HSLA values or with predefined color names.

allQuestion.questionText: Which property is used to set colors in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: The color property is used to set and change colors in HTML.

allQuestion.questionText: What are the types of unordered lists in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: The unordered lists in HTML can form bullets of form Circle, Square and Disc.

allQuestion.questionText: Which property is used to set border colors in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: The border property is used to change the border properties, including color in HTML.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following things are necessary to create an HTML page?
allQuestion.explanation: With a text editor and a web browser we can create an HTML page.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following tags is used to indicate the page’s start and endpoints?
allQuestion.explanation: <html> tag indicates the web browser where a webpage starts and ends.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following is true about HTML tags?
allQuestion.explanation: HTML tags are not case-sensitive in nature.

allQuestion.questionText: Which HTML tag is called the root element of an HTML document?
allQuestion.explanation: The <html> tag is the root element of an HTML document, which means that it contains all the contents and tags of the HTML document within it.

allQuestion.questionText: How is black color represented in terms of RGB values?
allQuestion.explanation: RCB(0, 0, 0) is equivalent to black color in terms of RGB values.

allQuestion.questionText: What does the Alpha value in RGBA represent?
allQuestion.explanation: A in RGBA represents the value of the Alpha Channel which is a measure of the Opacity of a color.

allQuestion.questionText: What does the Alpha value of 0.0 represent?
allQuestion.explanation: The Alpha value varies between 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0(fully opaque).

allQuestion.questionText: How to set a font for a whole page?
allQuestion.explanation: <defaultfont> tag is used to set up a default font type for a whole page.

allQuestion.questionText: The CSS inside HTML elements used alongside style attribute is called?
allQuestion.explanation: The CSS used alongside the style attribute with HTML elements is called Inline CSS.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following colors contain equal amounts of RBG?
allQuestion.explanation: Gray is RGB(50, 50, 50), White is RGB(100, 100, 100) and Black is RGB(0, 0, 0).

allQuestion.questionText: What is the speciality about the <small> and <big> tags in HTML?

options.text: They can be used for text only.

allQuestion.explanation: The tags can be repeated and their effects and stacked on top of each other.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following tags is used to add a row to a table in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: <tr> is used to add a row to a table in HTML.

allQuestion.questionText: Which property allows an image link to show a text label?
allQuestion.explanation: The alt property allows an image link to show a text label.

allQuestion.questionText: If a background image is smaller than the screen on which it is being displayed, what will occur on the webpage?

options.text: The blank space will be shown in black.

allQuestion.explanation: By default on most screens, if the background image is smaller than the screen on which it is being displayed, the image will be repeated.

allQuestion.questionText: What are the properties of block-level elements?

options.text: It always starts on a new line.
It always takes the full width available.
It has a top and bottom margin.

allQuestion.explanation: All the above properties are valid properties of block-level elements.

allQuestion.questionText: Which of the following are examples of block-level elements in HTML?
allQuestion.explanation: All the above examples satisfy the properties in Prob. 41 and hence are block-level elements

allQuestion.questionText: How many characters can be written in 1KB?
allQuestion.explanation: 1024 characters can be written in a file of size 1KB.

allQuestion.questionText: What are some valid character sets available?
allQuestion.explanation: All of the above options are examples of valid character sets.

allQuestion.questionText: The default value of the BORDER attribute is?
allQuestion.explanation: 1pixel is the default value for the BORDER attribute in HTML.

allQuestion.questionText: What are those objects called which are used for storing data on the client provided by the HTML local storage?
allQuestion.explanation: Such objects with the property mentioned above are called as Windows.localStorage or Window.sessionStorage.

allQuestion.questionText: The most basic part of any HTML page is?
allQuestion.explanation: ASCII Text comprises the most basic part of any HTML page, as it is the simplest character set a webpage can use.

allQuestion.questionText: What is the select tag used for?

options.text: Select some attributes and change their style.

allQuestion.explanation: A HTML combo box is created using the select tag.

allQuestion.questionText: What are the main components of the front end of any working website?
allQuestion.explanation: HTML, CSS, and Javascript combined to form the basic components of any working website’s frontend.

allQuestion.questionText: Which HTML tag is used to set up a Javascript-like client-side scripting language?
allQuestion.explanation: <script> tag is used for the purpose of setting up a client-side scripting language.
